page.title: 14Industry, Scoutmoor.
page.content: Lodge Mill closed in its capacity as a textile mill in the early 1960's and has since been sub-let as private units for a range of service industries. Of particular interest is a firm making mainly lamp-stands, ash trays etc. using onyx as a raw material. This industry has grown from one man's interest and appreciation of the beauty of onyx from a holiday in Italy, to a highly successful family business. The owner travels to Pakistan in order to select his onyx, which normally arrives as 6 tonne blocks. Imports also come from Mexico, via the port of Hull. The local 'soft' water is purified using a tower and filler system but the owner has also bought geese and ducks to help keep the water clean.
